Authors:
Naozumi Kondo, Toshiyuki Tokiwa, Satoshi Omura, Kenichi
Nonaka
Title:
Metapochonia hahajimaensis (Clavicipitaceae, Hypocreales), a
new hyphomycetes from soil from Hahajima Island, Tokyo, Japan
Keywords:
Anamorph, Morphology, Multigene phylogeny, Oceanic
islands, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Three isolates were obtained from soil samples collected
from Hahajima, Ogasawara Islands, Japan. Using a combination of
morphological characteristics and multigene (ITS, SSU, LSU, TEF)
phylogenics, the isolates were identified as a Metapochonia species
which were previously undescribed. Metapochonia hahajimaensis, a new
species, is distinguished from the closely-related M. bulbillosa and M.
gonioides or other Metapochonia taxa by conidial size and colonial
characteristics.
